meanings.definition: The act of equipping or providing with weapons or armor.
meanings.sent1: The armings of the soldiers were done meticulously before the battle.
meanings.sent2: The knight's armings were shining in the sunlight as he rode into battle.
meanings.sent3: The armings of the squirrels with acorns for their winter stash was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The armings of the storm clouds with lightning bolts signaled an impending thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The armings of the fortress walls made them impenetrable to enemy attacks.

meanings.definition: The act of preparing for conflict or danger.
meanings.sent1: The armings of the town against the approaching invaders began in earnest.
meanings.sent2: The armings of the hikers with extra supplies saved them when they got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The armings of the cat with a bell on its collar amused the children as it jingled around.
meanings.sent4: The armings of the team with strategies for the competition gave them an edge over their rivals.
meanings.sent5: The armings of the house against burglars included installing a security system.

meanings.definition: The act of loading or setting a weapon in a state of readiness.
meanings.sent1: The armings of the archer's bow with an arrow was swift and precise.
meanings.sent2: The armings of the cannons on the ship were crucial for repelling pirate attacks.
meanings.sent3: The armings of the chef with a whisk and bowl made him ready to bake a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: The armings of the car with a full tank of gas ensured a smooth road trip.
meanings.sent5: The armings of the security guard with a flashlight helped him patrol the dark corridors.
